data.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 73 South Euclid Avenue in Montauk, New York, as the “Perry B. Duryea, Jr. Post Office”. (2004; 108th Congress H.R. 4427)
data.meta_description: Aug 9, 2004. H.R. 4427 (108th).  In GovTrack.us, a database of bills in the U.S. Congress.
data.text:
H.R. 4427 (108th) was a bill in the United States Congress.

A bill must be passed by both the House and Senate in identical form and then be signed by the President to become law.

Bills numbers restart every two years. That means there are other bills with the number H.R. 4427. This is the one from the 108th Congress.

This bill was introduced in the 108th Congress, which met from Jan 7, 2003 to Dec 9, 2004. Legislation not passed by the end of a Congress is cleared from the books.
